info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:23PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Goliad and northwestern Refugio Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 422 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Blanconia, or 10 miles south of Goliad, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Goliad and northwestern Refugio Counties. This includes US Highway 183 between mile markers 648 and 662. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
